intro: Pedicularis ludovici, commonly known as the Lüdovici's lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, commonly known as the broomrape family, and is characterized by its hemiparasitic nature, deriving some of its nutrients from host plants. The plant produces showy, spurred flowers that range in color from pink to purple, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It typically grows in alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions with well-drained soil. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
